Message: Refactor tests. Move repeated parts out.
Description: This commit aims several goals. 1) Refactor DRY code. Move it to global space. 2) Checking console warnings is done for all components now. It's a win. 3) Also this is some help for future React deprecations detections. The stub is used instead of spy to prevent console output polluting. But anonymous function in second argument of assert gives us the warning message we should be aware of if the test fails.
Message Abstract: Refactor tests. Move repeated parts out.
Description Abstract: This commit aims several goals. 1) Refactor DRY code. Move it to global space. 2) Checking console warnings is done for all components now. It's a win. 3) Also this is some help for future React deprecations detections. The stub is used instead of spy to prevent console output polluting. But anonymous function in second argument of assert gives us the warning message we should be aware of if the test fails.

Message Abstract: Temporarily skip test for Input because of bug507

Description: Test is included. When mode is production webpack strips out code for development mode. React console warnings also are removed in production. In that case tests don't see any console warnings from React. Consequently code like this (in tests)   console.warn.called.should.be.false; is useless.
Description Abstract: Test is included. When mode is production webpack strips out code for development mode. React console warnings also are removed in production. In that case tests don't see any console warnings from React. Consequently code like this (in tests)   console.warn.called.should.be.false; is useless.

Message: [fixed] Don't try to access .ownerDocument on null
Description: We previously did not take into account that React.findDOMNode(this) can return null, (for example if you have a modal and only want to render the overlay). We now fallback to the root document in that case. https://github.com/react-bootstrap/react-bootstrap/commit/ee0382e
Message Abstract: [fixed] Don't try to access .ownerDocument on null
Description Abstract: We previously did not take into account that React.findDOMNode(this) can return null, (for example if you have a modal and only want to render the overlay). We now fallback to the root document in that case. link

Message: [changed] Source to ES6 using Babel and Webpack
Description: A lot has happened since this projects inception and newer tools are available that can facilitate a better development environment. This work gives the project structure a facelift to meet the current trends of the broader React community.  Source cleanup Rename all js files to *.js Use Babel for our es6 -> es5 transpilation Update all js to es6 standards src test docs doc examples ie8 visual test   ESLint all .js files Build Use Webpack - This should provide more     control on how we build our pre-concatenated and minified releases. Drop Grunt, use npm scripts and shell scripts where needed. Promise based release process (faster) Update README to explain how to run. Test Single karma config file Not dependent on building src to disk to run, use     karma-webpack which will     build the src in memory. Better test watcher that re-runs tests when changing src files.     Current watcher only runs if test files change. Fail on linting errors Pull es5-shim from npm Docs Pull bootstrap from npm Pull codemirror from npm Use in browser Babel transformer for doc examples Consolidate package.json deps and scripts to repo root. Leads to     less confusion on how to run the docs locally. Update README for local setup.
Message Abstract: [changed] Source to ES6 using Babel and Webpack
Description Abstract: A lot has happened since this projects inception and newer tools are available that can facilitate a better development environment. This work gives the project structure a facelift to meet the current trends of the broader React community. Source cleanup Rename all js files to *.js Use Babel for our es6 -> es5 transpilation Update all js to es6 standards src test docs doc examples ie8 visual test ESLint all .js files Build Use Webpack - This should provide more     control on how we build our pre-concatenated and minified releases. Drop Grunt, use npm scripts and shell scripts where needed. Promise based release process (faster) Update README to explain how to run. Test Single karma config file Not dependent on building src to disk to run, use     karma-webpack which will     build the src in memory. Better test watcher that re-runs tests when changing src files.     Current watcher only runs if test files change. Fail on linting errors Pull es5-shim from npm Docs Pull bootstrap from npm Pull codemirror from npm Use in browser Babel transformer for doc examples Consolidate package.json deps and scripts to repo root. Leads to     less confusion on how to run the docs locally. Update README for local setup.

Description: Col Push/Pull/Offset value zero support
Description Abstract: Col Push/Pull/Offset value zero support

Description: docs: Added line about grunt build
Description Abstract: docs: Added line about grunt build

Description: According to the Bootstrap documentation (and my own experience), column offsets must be reset to zero for other sizes if not used. "In addition to column clearing at responsive breakpoints, you may need to reset offsets, pushes, or pulls. See this in action in the grid example." For example <Col xsOffset={2} xs={8} sm={4} md={4} lg={4}>...</Col> when viewed in 'sm/md/lg' does not produce the expected result of having a column width of '4'. It looks only correct when viewed in 'xs'. The example would have to be rewritten as <Col xs={8} xsOffset={2} sm={4} smOffset={0} md={4} mdOffset={0} lg={4} lgOffset={0}>...</Col> to render correctly in all views. However, Offset/Push/Pull property values were ran through a "truthy" check in Col.jsx. So when the property value was 0 the column would not render. This has been fixed by doing a >= 0 check instead which ensures that the property value is simply a non-negative number.
Description Abstract: According to the Bootstrap documentation (and my own experience), column offsets must be reset to zero for other sizes if not used. "In addition to column clearing at responsive breakpoints, you may need to reset offsets, pushes, or pulls. See this in action in the grid example." For example ... when viewed in 'sm/md/lg' does not produce the expected result of having a column width of '4'. It looks only correct when viewed in 'xs'. The example would have to be rewritten as ... to render correctly in all views. However, Offset/Push/Pull property values were ran through a "truthy" check in Col.jsx. So when the property value was 0 the column would not render. This has been fixed by doing a >= 0 check instead which ensures that the property value is simply a non-negative number.

Message: [added] bsSize prop to Input, supporting input groups
Description: This allows for specifying a size, such as 'small' or 'large', such as: <Input   type="text"   placeholder="Search"   bsSize="small"   buttonAfter={<Button><Glyphicon glyph="search" /></Button>}   />  (Input groups are enabled whenever these props have values: addonBefore, addonAfter, buttonBefore, or buttonAfter) This maps to the "input-group-sm" and "input-group-lg" classes as documented here: http://getbootstrap.com/components/#input-groups-sizing
Message Abstract: [added] bsSize prop to Input, supporting input groups
Description Abstract: This allows for specifying a size, such as 'small' or 'large', such as: \\}   /> (Input groups are enabled whenever these props have values: addonBefore, addonAfter, buttonBefore, or buttonAfter) This maps to the "input-group-sm" and "input-group-lg" classes as documented here: link

Message: [changed] Move built components to lib directory
Description: In the past this library has suffered from accidentally pushing this repo directly to npm without the built components. There has been a separate repo to which the built source has been pushed and later deployed from. While the approach is feasible it prevents you from using the npm link feature, for easy testing of changes in your own application.  This should address concerns like #325, #218, and any others like them that I have missed. In particular this is the fix for an automated setup as mentioned in #292. If you are currently using components directly from this library, then you will need to change your reference path. For example require('react-bootstrap/Alert') should now be require('react-bootstrap/lib/Alert'). require('react-bootstrap').Alert will still work. This applies to both CommonJS and AMD usages.
Message Abstract: [changed] Move built components to lib directory
Description Abstract: In the past this library has suffered from accidentally pushing this repo directly to npm without the built components. There has been a separate repo to which the built source has been pushed and later deployed from. While the approach is feasible it prevents you from using the npm link feature, for easy testing of changes in your own application.  This should address concerns like #325, #218, and any others like them that I have missed. In particular this is the fix for an automated setup as mentioned in #292. If you are currently using components directly from this library, then you will need to change your reference path. For example require('react-bootstrap/Alert') should now be require('react-bootstrap/lib/Alert'). require('react-bootstrap').Alert will still work. This applies to both CommonJS and AMD usages.

Message: Future proof cwp, remove unused internal utils
Description: Adds a version check to cwp so that it only wraps child.type in a mock factory for version 0.12, as it would break in 0.13, where react.createElement === require("react/lib/ReactElement").createElement will be true
Message Abstract: Future proof cwp, remove unused internal utils
Description Abstract: Adds a version check to cwp so that it only wraps child.type in a mock factory for version 0.12, as it would break in 0.13, where react.createElement === require("react/lib/ReactElement").createElement will be true

Description: Rename "navOpen" to "navExpanded"

Description: There seems to be a non-working mix navOpen and navExpanded which means getInitialState() sets navExpanded in the state, but isNavOpen refers to the uninitialised navOpen. I have made it all use navExpanded, which appears to be the intention, and also added some sensible defaults to make it easier to get right.
Description Abstract: There seems to be a non-working mix navOpen and navExpanded which means getInitialState() sets navExpanded in the state, but isNavOpen refers to the uninitialised navOpen. I have made it all use navExpanded, which appears to be the intention, and also added some sensible defaults to make it easier to get right.

Message: Fix for manual mode of OverlayTrigger.
Description: Before this fix it was not possible to refer to the component wrapped by the OverlayTrigger using the ref property, because it was not cloned using cloneWithProps. Now, in manuel mode,  we just return the unmodified child which will still have the ref and all children. (cherry picked from commit 4e54431)
Message Abstract: Fix for manual mode of OverlayTrigger.
Description Abstract: Before this fix it was not possible to refer to the component wrapped by the OverlayTrigger using the ref property, because it was not cloned using cloneWithProps. Now, in manuel mode,  we just return the unmodified child which will still have the ref and all children. (cherry picked from commit 4e54431)

Message: Only access document.body after component has been mounted
Description: document.body is null before the body tag has loaded, which means when loading react-bootstrap.js in the <head> would result in the container prop being null. This change moves the document.body accessing into the getDOMNode fn which is only called after the component has been mounted. closes #180
Message Abstract: Only access document.body after component has been mounted
Description Abstract: document.body is null before the body tag has loaded, which means when loading react-bootstrap.js in the  would result in the container prop being null. This change moves the document.body accessing into the getDOMNode fn which is only called after the component has been mounted. closes #180

Description: Moved propTypes to utils and renamed to CustomPropTypes so its not confused as a proxy of React.PropTypes. Update componentClass validator to match PropType signature, it now returns an Error if invalid instead of a boolean. Added mountable validator. TESTS!

Message: Added huge hack to support doing cloneWithProps on both React 0.10 and
Description: React 0.11.
Message Abstract: Added huge hack to support doing cloneWithProps on both React 0.10 and
Description Abstract: React 0.11.

Message: Copy over internal React functions to /utils folder, update references.
Description: Removed all references to react/lib files, and move necessary functions into their own files in a utils directory including: classSet, cloneWithProps, createChainedFunction, EventListener, merge, and TransitionEvents. If/when these become available through React we can remove these files.
Message Abstract: Copy over internal React functions to /utils folder, update references.
Description Abstract: Removed all references to react/lib files, and move necessary functions into their own files in a utils directory including: classSet, cloneWithProps, createChainedFunction, EventListener, merge, and TransitionEvents. If/when these become available through React we can remove these files.

Message: Convert source module format from ES6 to CommonJS
Description: The es6 module transpiler currently doesn't have a way to exclude 3rd party libs which meant we have had to keep copies of React lib files converted to use es6 module imports in our repo, this is bad practice as it means we are unnecessarily locking react bootstrap to a specific react version. This change swaps the module format to CommonJS which (for the moment) has more mature tooling support allowing this functionality.
Message Abstract: Convert source module format from ES6 to CommonJS
Description Abstract: The es6 module transpiler currently doesn't have a way to exclude 3rd party libs which meant we have had to keep copies of React lib files converted to use es6 module imports in our repo, this is bad practice as it means we are unnecessarily locking react bootstrap to a specific react version. This change swaps the module format to CommonJS which (for the moment) has more mature tooling support allowing this functionality.

Description: This change included general logic cleanup as well as the following changes: Fixed issues * Clear any timers on componentWillUnmount or null any async actions via this.isMounted which would cause set states after the component has been unmounted, resolves #112. * Prevent default on next and prev callbacks which stops hashes being set to the url. * Clear auto slide interval timer on manual change to stop multiple timers being set. Added functionality * Added onSlideEnd prop - useful for queuing state changes. * Added basic unit tests.
Description Abstract: This change included general logic cleanup as well as the following changes: Fixed issues * Clear any timers on componentWillUnmount or null any async actions via this.isMounted which would cause set states after the component has been unmounted, resolves #112. * Prevent default on next and prev callbacks which stops hashes being set to the url. * Clear auto slide interval timer on manual change to stop multiple timers being set. Added functionality * Added onSlideEnd prop - useful for queuing state changes. * Added basic unit tests.

Description: Move docs build logic into the docs dir and remove from main gruntfile. Setup site based on https://github.com/andreypopp/react-quickstart. This creates a express based server which generates files on request's removing the need for a user to rebuild the static files. Removed static files (*.html, bundle.js) from repo and git ignored, this will stop merge conflicts and these files are no longer needed for general development.
Description Abstract: Move docs build logic into the docs dir and remove from main gruntfile. Setup site based on link. This creates a express based server which generates files on request's removing the need for a user to rebuild the static files. Removed static files (*.html, bundle.js) from repo and git ignored, this will stop merge conflicts and these files are no longer needed for general development.

Description: Use key instead of array index, this allows Tabs to be reordered without updated without needing to working the new activeIndex. Use render functions instead of pushing to arrays stored on the component, this is more consistent with the other components. Removed utils#isArray() should be able to rely on an es5 environment since React itself requires this. @see http://facebook.github.io/react/docs/working-with-the-browser .html#browser-support-and-polyfills
Description Abstract: Use key instead of array index, this allows Tabs to be reordered without updated without needing to working the new activeIndex. Use render functions instead of pushing to arrays stored on the component, this is more consistent with the other components. Removed utils#isArray() should be able to rely on an es5 environment since React itself requires this. @see link .html#browser-support-and-polyfills

Description: ClassName helpers refactor
Description Abstract: ClassName helpers refactor

Description: Use react/lib/cx and react/lib/ReactTestUtils in favour of react/addons, provides more efficient builds. Remove BootstrapMixin#getClassSetFromClassName() in favour of using React#transferPropsTo() to mixin state.className. Create BootstrapMixin#getBsClassSet() based on BootstrapMixin#extendClassName() but returns a classSet instead of a className and doesn't mixin state.className. Refactor components to use classSet to define className. Minor whitespace cleanup.
Description Abstract: Use react/lib/cx and react/lib/ReactTestUtils in favour of react/addons, provides more efficient builds. Remove BootstrapMixin#getClassSetFromClassName() in favour of using React#transferPropsTo() to mixin state.className. Create BootstrapMixin#getBsClassSet() based on BootstrapMixin#extendClassName() but returns a classSet instead of a className and doesn't mixin state.className. Refactor components to use classSet to define className. Minor whitespace cleanup.
